header.title: tags

erlref.modulesummary: Generate Emacs TAGS file from Erlang source files.

description.p: A TAGS file is used by Emacs to find function and variable definitions in any source file in large projects. This module can generate a TAGS file from Erlang source files. It recognizes functions, records, and macro definitions.

func.name: file(File [, Options])
func.fsummary: Creates a TAGSfile for the file File.

desc.p: Creates a TAGS file for the file File.

func.name: files(FileList [, Options])
func.fsummary: Creates a TAGS file for the files in the listFileList.

desc.p: Creates a TAGS file for the files in the list FileList.

func.name: dir(Dir [, Options])
func.fsummary: Creates a TAGS file for all files in directory Dir.

desc.p: Creates a TAGS file for all files in directory Dir.

func.name: dirs(DirList [, Options])
func.fsummary: Creates a TAGS file for all files in any directory in DirList.

desc.p: Creates a TAGS file for all files in any directory in DirList.

func.name: subdir(Dir [, Options])
func.fsummary: Descends recursively down directory Dir and creates a TAGS file based on all files found.

desc.p: Descends recursively down directory Dir and creates a TAGS file based on all files found.

func.name: subdirs(DirList [, Options])
func.fsummary: Descends recursively down all directories in DirList and creates a TAGSfile based on all files found.

desc.p: Descends recursively down all directories in DirList and creates a TAGS file based on all files found.

func.name: root([Options])
func.fsummary: Creates a TAGS file covering all files in the Erlang distribution.

desc.p: Creates a TAGS file covering all files in the Erlang distribution.

section.title: Options
section.p: The functions in this module have an optional argument, Options, which is a list that can contain the following elements:

item.p: Creates a TAGS file named NameOfTAGSFile.
Creates a file named TAGS in directory NameOfDirectory.

section.p: The default behavior is to create a file named TAGS in the current directory.

item.p: A file named root.TAGS is created in the current directory. The file contains references to all Erlang source files in the Erlang distribution.
A file named TAGS is created in directory ../projectdir. The file contains information about the functions, records, and macro definitions of the three files.

section.title: See Also
section.p: Anders Lindgren: The Erlang editing mode for Emacs. Ericsson, 1998
Richard M. Stallman: GNU Emacs Manual, chapter "Editing Programs", section "Tag Tables". Free Software Foundation, 1995
